column2: "...<%me>. Don't you feel like you're being watched?"
"That... it's probably our consciousness."
"The surrounding ocean. That is, consciousness. Our consciousness."
"Our... consciousness?"
"Once, those called Photoners and I communicated, about golden ages and the ruins of those collapsed."
"Accepting the existence of humans, or giving up life. Those that decided to become one with me... were the Photoners."
"Umm... so this ocean is alive?"
"Life, it originally came from the ocean. The creation of life, it started in oceans. That includes me, as well."
"A solitary existence, a planet with only an ocean. A planet, with nothing but an ocean. ...Suddenly, knowledge was born."
"That ocean that gained knowledge, from the past until the present... by calculating all of creation, knew absolutely everything."
"The all-calculating observer of the universe."
"The Photoners met that ocean. Then, they gave that ocean a name. That name, was Xion."
"When I met the Photoners, I stopped being an observer."
"I remembered their words, actively interacted with them. I tried to understand them."
"This appearance. I assumed the appearance of the very first Photoner I met."
"Their first reaction when they saw this appearance... was funny. It was something that couldn't be calculated."
"I asked them to cover me... the entire planet... in armor, to change me."
"Now, this mobile planet is called the Mothership."
"The creation of this was to assure the welfare of the Photoners, in order to walk with them."
"...Yes, I must have been extremely happy."
"I was so happy to meet other existences besides myself... and made a mistake."
"I forgot my role as an observer. To calculate, and not to contact anything... That was how things should have been."
"The Photoners were not evil. Looking at their actions, they should be called common occurrences in evolution."
"If the Photoners weren't around, the Darkers most likely wouldn't be either. But then, the ARKS wouldn't exist either."
"Yes, the Photoners were greedy, brimming with curiosity, moderately lazy, arrogant... righteous people."
"No longer being an observer and teaching them knowledge of Photons... What I did... was wrong."
"...but, I was lonely."
"It's a conclusion I find hard to understand."
"That can't be. Xion, you should understand."
"I... I was lonely. Scared, and in pain. I wished to be saved by someone."
"That's when <%me> came, and saved me."
"I've forgotten absolutely everything. But <%me>'s name, and that joy I felt at that moment, I remember."
"Xion, you're the same. When you met the Photoners, you were delighted. Being alone, must have been so lonely..."
"Yes. Xion, you must have been lonely."
"...You... it can't be... Are you... my relative... or my memories...?"
"No, I can feel them. Your emotions, I can feel them."
"You were lonely, so you called out. There's nothing wrong with that."
"What went wrong happened afterwards. Xion, you also think that."
"That's why, in order to fix it, you let <%me> and I meet you, right?"
"...Ah, that's what it was. That emotion I had at the very beginning. That was... loneliness."
"...Xion!"
"<%me>! Hurry, we need to get further in!"
"Your quest progress has been saved."
